name: The Chance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The Chance for 3 nights at the end of the Easter break. It was great - couldn't fault it. The accommodation was lovely with views over the fields and the food was lovely with lots of choice. Sally and Paul were very friendly with lots of local information. We would definitely come again.
reviews.title: Definitely come again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this beautiful home for two nights at the end of July. Sally was the perfect host in every way, from her warm welcome to booking dinner for us on both nights. She has perfected the art of B&B! Her breakfast was fantastic from the selection of fresh fruit to her full english. The rooms are very tastefully decorated with everything you need tea, coffee making facilites etc. Location is perfect with plenty of parking. Haven't a single fault with this B&B.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The previous reviews say everything possible about this home. We have stayed in some very nice B&B's and they have nothing on The Chance. Sally has taken every possible step to make sure everything you need, every convenience you may want and every question you have will be satisfied and answered. There are little touches Sally has added to these rooms that make you shake your head as you come across them, wondering how she thought of it. As I told her on several occasions during our stay, she could make a fortune in the United States with a bed and breakfast. She understands what people need or want from a B&B and provides it without hesitation and with the kind of friendliness that is not always found. Her welcome is more than friendly and her breakfasts are incredible. Her knowledge of the area is like a history lesson. She asks your plans for the day each morning and her suggestions are always right on. She welcomes you each evening, asking how your day has been and is genuinely interested in your thoughts and experiences. She seems to really enjoy sharing her home with you. At the end of the day, what more can you ask for. Chipping Campden is a beautiful village to explore The Cotswolds and The Chance is more than you can ask for. Thank you Sally, for helping to make our first expereince to England such an enjoyable time. We won't forget your smile.
reviews.title: Exceptional In Every Way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Chance is the best B&B we have ever encountered. Sally is the PERFECT host, saw to every detail, and gave us excellent advise for seeing her beloved Cotswolds. Breakfast was amazing, our room was more than comfortable, and Sally was truly delightful. The location, with ample car park, served as excellent base for daytrips to other towns and for walking Chipping Campden area. Thank you Sally for everything!
reviews.title: Perfect in Every Way !

reviews.text: The previous reviews have got it right. I stayed in the Aston Room and was impressed with its cleanliness, rural views, fridge, ample refreshments, shower with decent water pressure, number of power sockets, wifi, books, magazines - very functional and attractive. Breakfasts were the highlight of my day with high quality ingredients and extras on hand like decaf tea and coffee. But the real joy of The Chance is Sally herself - a delightful hostess eager to assist in any way she can. It would be churlish to complain about anything in this review (not that I want to!), because Sally would go out of her way to put to right whatever issues you might have.
reviews.title: Outstanding in every way
The compleat B&B in every sense
reviews.text: We stayed at The Chance with sally and Paul for two nights which we booked from our home in Australia (no deposit required which is exceptional and trusting in this day and age!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where do we start, everything read in trip advisor was spot on and the attention to detail is amazing, even down to a universal plug for international visitors. Don't expect to eat lunch after one of Sally's wonderful breakfasts!!
reviews.title: Our favorite place to stay during our month trip to the U.K.
Best B & B we experienced during our holiday
reviews.text: Sally is a mine of information as she has always lived in the area and is a one person information centre!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free broadband was so useful for making onward bookings and we were a five minute walk to the village centre.
reviews.title: the warm english welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at the Chance made our visit to the Cotswolds a much more enjoyable experience and would definately recomend it.
reviews.title: One of the best B & B's we've ever stayed in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great 3-night stay with Sally and Paul at The Chance.
reviews.title: Warm, Friendly, Fantastic

reviews.text: Room: We stayed in the Campden, a cozy room, warmly decorated with lots of charm. The en-suite bathroom was spotless and included a large soaking tub - with rubber ducky. Other little details - such as a spare international electricity adapter in the dresser drawer - show the care and thought Sally and Paul show in running their B&B.
reviews.title: Great owners, perfect place in Cotswold

reviews.text: Location: The property is located just off of High Street and is super easy walking distance to the center of town. Off-street parking is available just out the front door.
reviews.title: Setting the bar very, very high!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast: Sally surprised us with her flexibility when it came to the delicious breakfasts she prepared. There is no set menu to select from, but a lovely list of items to combine as you wish. And rather than a fixed time for breakfast, we were able to amble down at a time that worked for us by just letting her know the evening ahead.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hosts: Sally and Paul have renovated this home to provide guests with a great stay that helps you feel more like a local. Sally was a joy to talk to and we enjoyed getting to know the Cotswolds through her descriptions of growing up in the area and how it's evolved over time. She's born to be a B&B owner and made us feel completely welcome.
reviews.title: the lovliest stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at The Chance. Sally is very inviting and made us comfortable immediately. Our room was very warm and comfortable and nicely decorated. In the room were lots of books and magazines about the Cotswolds - we found them very helpful. Sally offered to lend us a map and helped us with directions to the Rollright Stones. Also, in the room was a variety of teas and hot chocolate and really nice bath robes. The towels were so large, they were almost too heavy to lift. The Chance is conveniently located within a short walk of town center. Easy walk to lots of restaurant options. Chipping Campden and The Chance was the ideal spot for our base in the Cotswolds.
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay at The Chance B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 2 nights at The Chance. Our hostess Sally is a perfect hostess - chirpy and helpful and the most fantastic English Breakfast cook. Full of little thoughtful touches like an international adaptor and trail guide for local walks in our room, I absolutely could not find one single aspect of our stay that wasn't divine. Loved every relaxing minute.
reviews.title: Lovely, homey B&B

reviews.text: We spend 5 (!) nights at Sally's B&B and we would have liked to stay longer. The room was perfect, very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was very good: fresh fruits, nice bread and lovely cooked food.
reviews.title: Lovely B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sally was very nice and gave good advice about where to go, where to eat.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here after reading the reviews on trip advisor, was not dissapointed. Sally was brilliant, very informative and emailed me places to visit before we arrived so we were able to plan and pack as much into the 2 days as possible! Breakfast was fantasitc, did us all day!!! Lovely room, very clean. Have recommended to work colleagues and are treating the parents as soon as the weather warms!
reviews.title: Beautiful B&B, excellent food, outstanding hostess - The Chance has it all!

description: "The Chance" is a family home offering traditional Bed and Breakfast accommodation in the beautiful town of Chipping Campden. Built in 1921 of Cotswold stone quarried from the surrounding hills and situated less than a 10 minute walk from the centre of one of the most beautiful and interesting high streets in the North Cotswolds. Guests are guaranteed off road parking, free wi-fi and comfortable guest accommodation, all with private ensuite facilities. We offer a choice of either double bed super king size (US King)or Twin Bed accommodation. Breakfasts are traditionally English with locally sourced ingredients cooked to order. Any specific diet requirements catered for with prior knowledge. Guests are welcome to borrow local road & footpath maps & help is available with cycle hire or Cotswold Tours.
